page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO WEST CAMBS.
page.content:
The area is situated on the western fringes of Cambridgeshire, within one kilometre of the Bedfordshire boundary and less than three kilometres from Northamptonshire. The land, which is low-lying and gently-undulating, is mainly used for arable farming.
Most of the hundred and fifty inhabitants live in the village of Stow Longa, but the area also includes the southern edge of Catworth, a small settlement near the disused Kimbolton railway station, the hamlet of Little Catworth and several outlying farms.
Two minor roads cross the area, linking the A45 and A6O4, and giving easy access to the A1, M1 and M11, as well as to the East Coast.
